news_items.content: Here's the rewritten version of the news:

India braces for potential conflict amid rising tensions with Pakistan. The Indian government has urged caution in its response to growing violence and instability along the border. However, India-Pakistan relations remain strained.

In other news, a recent Lancet study suggests that analyzing an individual's selfie may predict cancer survival rates. Researchers found that by analyzing facial features extracted from selfies, it is possible to identify individuals at higher risk of developing certain types of cancer.

On a more personal note, Indian cricketer Virat Kohli has expressed his intention to retire from Test cricket, citing the need for a change in approach and the increasing intensity of international competition. The decision comes as the selectors have requested reconsideration after consulting with players.

The World Health Organization (WHO) has approved $2.4 billion in support for Pakistan under two economic programs. This move aims to alleviate the country's financial struggles and help it recover from recent challenges.

In technology news, OpenAI has announced that it plans to abandon its planned for-profit conversion model. The company is shifting its focus towards developing AI use cases within the bounds of the law.
SoftBank chairman Masayoshi Son has expressed optimism about the development of Artificial Intelligence (AI). He believes that AI will play a crucial role in driving economic growth and innovation.

The latest news also includes reports on a case where an Arizona man was shot to death in road rage, but he surprisingly returned to confront his killer. Additionally, Singapore's Vision for AI Safety aims to bridge the divide between countries with differing perspectives on artificial intelligence.

The US is reviewing its investment in Chinese AI startup Manus as part of its efforts to limit China's access to AI technology. Google has also been working on updates to its AI platform Gemini and Android 16.
